page.title: 18HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Basildon dates back to Roman Britain Excavations for the railway in 1836 uncovered evidence of the Roman settlement, portions of wall and pavement, pottery and a coin of Lucilla, daughter of Marcus Aurelius. Basildon was also the home of Jethro Tull, founder of the seed drill and author of{'Horse-Hoeing Husbandry' (1733). {Bere Court Manor}was granted to Abingdon Abbey in 1126. After the dissolution of the monasteries the house changed hands many times owners included the Dukes of Somerset and Northumberland and Queen Elizabeth 1. It is currently owned by Christopher Tucker who works in the film industry. Bere House was formerly the servants quarters. Kenneth Grahame, author of{'The Wind {in the}Willows', lived in Pangbourne.
